question.body: At which artery is blood pressure routinely measured?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The ulnar artery supplies blood to forearm and deep muscles of the arm.
Incorrect. The radial artery can be used to feel a pulse but is not used for blood pressure.
Incorrect. The axiallary artery is not used for blood pressure measurements.
Correct. The brachial artery is a common site for measuring blood pressure.
